name: io.bytes.per.checksum
description:
The number of bytes per checksum.  Must not be larger than
  io.file.buffer.size.

name: dfs.client.mmap.retry.timeout.ms
description:
The minimum amount of time that we will wait before retrying a failed mmap
    operation.

name: yarn.app.mapreduce.am.containerlauncher.threadpool-initial-size
description:
The initial size of thread pool to launch containers in the
    app master.

name: dfs.client.deadnode.detection.probe.connection.timeout.ms
description: Connection timeout for probing dead node in milliseconds.

name: dfs.datanode.block.id.layout.upgrade.threads
description:
The number of threads to use when creating hard links from
    current to previous blocks during upgrade of a DataNode to block ID-based
    block layout (see HDFS-6482 for details on the layout).

name: fs.trash.interval
description:
Number of minutes after which the checkpoint
  gets deleted.  If zero, the trash feature is disabled.
  This option may be configured both on the server and the
  client. If trash is disabled server side then the client
  side configuration is checked. If trash is enabled on the
  server side then the value configured on the server is
  used and the client configuration value is ignored.

name: dfs.mover.movedWinWidth
description:
The minimum time interval, in milliseconds, that a block can be
    moved to another location again.

name: net.topology.script.number.args
description:
The max number of args that the script configured with
    net.topology.script.file.name should be run with. Each arg is an
    IP address.

name: dfs.namenode.fs-limits.max-xattr-size
description:
The maximum combined size of the name and value of an extended attribute
    in bytes. It should be larger than 0, and less than or equal to maximum
    size hard limit which is 32768.
    Support multiple size unit suffix(case insensitive), as described in
    dfs.blocksize.
